explanation: The report is correct. Given the provided project definitions, LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to the constant expression ((void)cfg, 0), so err is always initialized to 0. Therefore the conditional if (err) { return err; } can never be taken and is unreachable in this project configuration. That meets the definition of unreachable code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1, so the reported violation is valid (unless the project changes the macro definition such that the branch can be reached).
